results.title: The Gee whiz graph (NP)
results.creator_credit: Peter Robinson, Antony Jay and Video Arts
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “How to Lie with Statistics”.
John Cleese narrates the first of a series of animated cartoons based on the book by Darrell Huff and Irving Geis. Concentrates on the suppression of zero, and the change of scale in graphs. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: The Average chap
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to Lie with Statistics”.
The second in a series of animated cartoons based on the book by Darrell Huff and Irving Geis about statistical trickery. Concentrates on the use and misuse of averages. Intended for management training, colleges and schools. Narration by John Cleese. Animation by Tony Hart.

results.title: You are old, Father William
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Describes what happens to our mind and bodies as we grow older. Recent research into the physiology. Biochemistry, and psychology of old age is discussed. The processes of aging are many and complex and work at different rates. Although science is far from able to increase the maximum life span of human being. More and more people can live longer in better physical and meal health.

results.title: What's wrong with the sun?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Looks at some of the observations which have caused a crisis in the study of our sun. Until recently it was thought to be a constant well-understood star. But now it is oscillating with frequent vibrations. This may mean a complete revision of our ideas about the inner temperature and composition of the sun and hence all other stars.

results.title: Whales, dolphins and men (D)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Dolphins and whales share a common ancestor; yet dolphins are the darlings of the public, while whales are the victims of commercial exploitation. The dolphin is considered man’s friend and playmate, the whale continues to be a victim of exploitation and face a very real danger of extinction. Discusses scientific studies of these marine mammals. Note: Some scenes may be offensive to animal lovers.

results.title: Way Out
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
London Transport, the world’s biggest urban transport system, is today widely regarded as being unreliable, expensive and slow. The film investigates how London Transport may be able to improve services

results.title: The Victims
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
When the World War Two concentration camps closed, prisoners of war were returned and hostages released. But the victims of those camps continue to suffer - the assault on their minds has often been as effective as the assault on their bodies. More recently the victims of kidnappers have suffered in the same way. In this documentary, the victims discuss their ordeals.

results.title: Uranium goes critical
results.creator_credit: Richard Reisz and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”
Discusses the role of uranium in the world’s energy situation. Maintains that at the present rate of use, uranium fuel could be used up in 20 to 30 years. Deals with the safety aspects of using uranium as a source of energy and asks if we should be looking at alternative technologies instead.
